//@2: NOTE: This file is to be used with npm to build out your libraries and SCSS.
If you do not intend to use npm, you can ignore this file.
-- Don't forget that you will need to run 'npm install' the first time
-- Most likely you want: 'npm run scss' which will build the foundation _settings.scss and ebi.global.scss
-- If you want to build foundation from source you'll need to run 'foundation-update' and then the scripts 'scss'.
name: ebi_framework

scripts.test: echo "To do: no test specified" && exit 1
scripts.scss: node-sass -o css css && csso ./css/ebi-global.css --output ./css/ebi-global.min.css && npm run foundation-scss
//@18: -- Our buildscript: With this line we concat all libraries to be installed at once --
scripts.libraries: npm run foundation-update && npm run message_finished
//@22: -- All our libraries, not intended to be run indiviudually --
scripts.foundation-update: wget https://github.com/zurb/foundation-sites/archive/develop.zip -d ./libraries/foundation-6.zip && del ./libraries/foundation-6 && extract-zip ./libraries/foundation-6.zip ./libraries/foundation-6/ && del ./libraries/foundation-6.zip && echo "Copying foundation files one level up as they've moved..." && ncp ./libraries/foundation-6/foundation-sites-develop/ ./libraries/foundation-6/ && del ./libraries/foundation-6/foundation-sites-develop/ && echo "Latest version of foundation downloaded, you'll need to run 'npm run scss' to build"
